article:
Events and trends *Assyrian king Ashurbanipal founds library, which includes our
earliest complete copy of the [[Epic of Gilgamesh]]. *649 BC â Indabigash
succeeds Tammaritu as a king of the Elamite Empire. *649 BC â Babylonian revolt
under Shamash-shuma-ukin is crushed by the Assyrians. *648 BC â Pankration
becomes an event at the Ancient Olympic Games. *April 6, 648 BCâEarliest Greek-
chronicled solar eclipse. *647 BC â King Assurbanipal of Assyria sacks Susa. *c.
647 BC â Assurbanipal and his Queen in the garden, from the palace at Nineveh
(modern Kuyunjik, Iraq) is made. It is now in The British Museum, London. *645
BCâIn the Chinese book of the [[Spring and Autumn Annals]], it was recorded that
on December 24 of this year there were five meteors seen in the sky over what is
now northern Shanqiu County, Henan Province. It was the first Chinese recording
of meteors. *641 BC â Tullus Hostilius dies and interregnum starts (traditional
date). *640 BC: Decisive victory of Assyria over Elamite Empire; Assurbanipal
captures its last king Khumma-Khaldash III, annexes Elam, and lays waste the
country. Potts, D. T. (1999) "The Archaeology of Elam: Formation and
Transformation of an Ancient Iranian State" (Cambridge World Archaeology)

Significant people
* 645 BCâDeath of Guan Zhong, Prime Minister of the Chinese state of Qi
* 645 BCâDeath of Archilochos, Greek poet (approximate date)
* 643 BCâDeath of Manasseh of Judah
* 643 BCâDeath of Duke Huan of Qi in China
* 641 BCâJosiah becomes king of Judah
* 640 BCâBirth of Stesichorus, Greek poet (approximate date)
